section.name: Phase 9: About this Document
section.P: This document describes functionality that will be built in Phase 9 of the Cytoscape / CPath project. The overall goal of Phase 9 is to prepare a complete beta release for internal use within cBio and MSKCC. This includes: web UI tweaks, better integration of the cPath and the Activity Center Cytoscape PlugIns, and importing of a complete sample data set.

subsection.name: 2.2 Modify Activity Center PlugIn to recognize Affymetrix IDs
subsection.P: In order to function correctly, the Activity Center requires two sets of data: a network graph and a list of expression values. These two data sets must use common identifiers. However, when retrieving data from cPath, interaction data will be specified in PSI-MI XML Format, and the primary identifier (usually specified in the names/shortLabel element) is not likely to match the identifier used in the expression data file. Hence, the PlugIn will not work correctly.

This should be a relatively simple fix. For simplification, we assume that the expression data is specified with Affymetrix IDs, and we also assume that cPath is preloaded with Affymetrix IDs, and that those Affymetrix IDs are specified in proteinInteractor/xref/primaryRef or secondaryRef. We then update the PlugIn to match graph data with expression data via the Affymetrix ID.
Open Issue: Is it OK if we currently assume Affymetrix IDs in the expression data file? Or should we allow the user to pick from a list of ID options?

Update the cPath PlugIn so that it is Cytoscape 2.0 compatible.
Open Issue: Should we include the SOFT Reader in the cPath PlugIn? Or Keep it out for now?

Open Issue: What is the specific use case of someone using this PlugIn? Will they 1) query cPath; 2) read in expression data? and then 3) run Activity Center Algorithm? Will this require that the two PlugIns can actually talk to one another, or just that they be loaded up together? Should we bundle the two plugins together? Where will the user get the expression data? Need to think about this some more.
